page.title: 11ST.HELEN'S CHURCH
page.content: St. Helen's Church is the oldest and finest building in the parish. Outside is a yew tree which overlooks what was the old well. It stands on a high mound surrounded by trees and flowers. The church was started about the time of the Norman Conquest and has changed during the 15th century. Today the church has traces of different periods during the years. In the 19th century three arches were built between the chancel and the nave for safety. The 2Oth century is represented by an oak altar in memory of the D'Arcy Clark family. The first organ was bought from Lichfield for Â£45.OO in 1864. The present one was bought 8 years ago.In the tower there are 6 bells three of which were added in 19O5.
